pr_title: SQL: Implement TOP as an alternative to LIMIT

timeline.message:
SQL: Implement TOP as an alternative to LIMIT

Add basic support for `TOP X` as a synonym to LIMIT X which is used
by [MS-SQL server](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/queries/top-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver15),
e.g.:

```
SELECT TOP 5 a, b, c FROM test
```

TOP in SQL server also supports the `PERCENTAGE` amd `WITH TIES`
keywords which this implementation doesn't.

Don't allow usage of both TOP and LIMIT in the same query.

Refers to #41195

timeline.bodyText: I'd prefer calling the method simply limit - it's not really wrapping but instead adding a new node to the tree.
timeline.author: costin

timeline.bodyText: Why not combining all three conditions in the same if?  More readable this way?

timeline.bodyText: I would rephrase the error a bit - TOP and LIMIT are not allowed in the same query - use one or the other.
